dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A middle-aged, middle-class, woman, NORMA, shuffles throu the bedroom door in dusty, once-fluffy slippers, a cup of in her hand, calling over her shoulder to her husband:

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Just once a week, Gary. It really doesn't cost that much. She turns back the bedspread as GARY follows her in, his feet slapping on the hardwood floor.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It's a waste. Norma hangs both of their bathrobes from pegs on the door backside and sets her teacup, still half-full, next to th telephone on a table just inside the door. She faces him.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Betty Johnson won a $500 blackout last Saturday. The mattress sags under Gary's weight. He doesn't respond She climbs into bed beside him.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I'll bet her husband doesn't think Bingo's a waste. I'll bet he was happy to help spend that $500.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Good night, Norma. He switches the bedside lamp off. In the darkness, they settle back into the pillows and LOOK UP. Scrawled on the ceiling in glow-in-the-dark paint are the chilling words:

dialogues.speaker: I'M UNDER THE BED
dialogues.text: Norma SCREAMS. Sitting bolt-upright, Gary snaps the lamp back on and pu steadying hand on his wife's shaking shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (gruffly) That little bastard! If he thinks this is funny, I'll make damn sure he thinks again.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Check. ‘ GARY What?

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Please. Check under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: It's a prank, that's all. Anton--

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Anton hasn't been home all day. He didn't do this. Oh, God, Gary, what if--

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Norma, no one's there, trust me. He swings over the edge of the bed, shoving the overhangi blankets out of his way. Upside-down, he looks under the and then hauls himself back up.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Okay? Nada. Now, can we-- She gasps, grabbing his arm.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: I heard something downstairs! Gary groans.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: Jesus, Norma.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Please? I won't be able to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: GARY
dialogues.text: (sighing, exasperated) Fine. Getting up, he yanks his bathrobe from its peg and opens door. .

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Be careful. Gary rolls his eyes and heads out. Norma clutches the blanket tight, listening to his footst descending the stairs and fading into the house until she can't. hear him at all. Alone, she fidgets nervously, looking back up at the céil The painted words are invisible in the lamplight. She scoots into the very center of the bed, gathering the covers around her, and calls: .

dialogues.speaker: NORMA,
dialogues.text: Gary? She listens hard, her entire body straining toward the op door, but there is no answer.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: (louder) Gary! A DULL THUD is barely audible, deep within the house. Her breath catches in her throat and she scrambles off th bed, hurrying out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma looks up and down the hall, dark except for a littl moonlight from the windows. The house is quiet. On tiptoe, careful not to make a sound, she moves along t wall to a closed door. She slowly turns the doorknob, opening the door a tiny cr and peeks into a BEDROOM.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Anton? The twin bed against the far wall is empty. Norma continu silently toward the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs, the ceiling creaks as Norma moves above. The entry way glows. with the soft moonlight filtering in thr frosted windows flanking the front door. At the bottom of the staircase, beside a small table, GAR HEAD AND SHOULDERS are visible on the floor. His eyes are wide open and a tiny bit of black-red blood trickles from mouth. The rest of his body is hidden in shadow. Just as Gary's head slides across the floor, DRAGGED INTO SHADOWS by an unseen force, Norma appears at the top of t staircase. She looks down and sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: (whispering) Gary? Gary? She creeps slowly down the stairs, her hands fumbling for banister. At the bottom, she checks the front door. The deadbolt is fastened tightly and the security alarm panel on the wall shows that the alarm is still on. She looks around the en way. A slight SCRABBLING SOUND comes from the shadows and she whirls, stepping toward the noise.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Gary, what-- Something SHOOTS OUT OF THE DARKNESS, directly at her. No SCREAMS, covering her face as the thing hits her... It's a cat, kicking and clawing at her. Norma breathes in relief, recognizing it. Wrapping her ar around it, she holds the cat tight and it calms. It's a . normal black and white housecat.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: Bones! It's okay, kitty. She leans to set the cat on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: NORMA
dialogues.text: It's okay. Where's Ga-- She stops cold. A small PUDDLE OF BLOOD on the floor glistens wetly in the moonlight. She drops the cat and races up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norma runs into the bedroom, grabbing the phone off the t by the door. Holding the receiver to her ear, she rushes the bed. Her teacup topples and smashes on the floor as t phone cord stretches out behind her. Fingers shaking, breathing hard, she dials a 9, then a 1.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The PHONE CORD IS YANKED behind her. The phone flies out her hands. She whips around to face the door and her face contorts i PURE TERROR. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BONES, the cat, leaps onto a rumpled twin bed, jolting 17 year-old ANTON awake. The clock reads 3:17 PM. Anton stretches. In a patch of autumn sunlight, the cat begins cleaning herself, but she's the only one. Anton merely grabs a fad purple T-shirt from a pile of dirty clothes on his floor heads for the door in a baseball cap and boxers. INT. LIVING ROOM -— SAME Anton lights about 30 sticks of incense and plops onto th couch.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Bones follows Anton downstairs, pausing at the little PUD OF BLOOD on the floor, unnoticed by Anton. Bones licks up the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton slides a long, plastic backscratcher from between t couch cushions. He gives his nuts a scratch or two and th uses the backscratcher to drag the TV remote over from th far side of the coffee table. He flips on the TV and sneaks a look around. Not a soul i sight.  6 Reaching under the couch with the backscratcher, he pulls an already-loaded Bart Simpson bong. Anton sparks up, inhaling the entire contents through a tube in Bart's but CELEB on TV You, too, can be financially independent! Own the house of your dreams, travel, live in luxury... Anton exhales slowly, paying rapt attention to the infomercial until -- CELEB on TV But this is no get-rich-quick scam. It requires motivation, dedication, and good old-fashioned hard work-- CLICK. Cartoons, much better. As Bones curls up beside him and cleans blood off her whiskers, Anton's stomach GROWLS lou He glances around and sees a Burger King bag near his fee He hooks the bag with his trusty backscratcher and pulls a decaying, half-eaten Whopper. He sniffs the burger, tears some of the green bits off it perimeter, and takes a bite. He chews once and immediatel spits it back into the bag. Sighing complainingly, and with exaggerated effort, Anton shoves Bart back into hiding, hauls his butt off the couc and plods toward the kitchen. INT. KITCHEN — SAME Anton pours a bowl of Lucky Charms and opens the fridge. Barren. He tilts the milk carton over his cereal. PLOP. One drop.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Mom! We're out of milk! Mom doesn't answer. DANZIG, the German Shepherd, whines a pokes his empty food dish with his nose.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You hungry, Danzig? What does she think, you can feed yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives Danzig a pat and opens a cupboard. It's bare.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Mom! We're out of dog food! Still no response. He pours the dog a bowl of Lucky Charm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton flops back onto the couch, munching dry cereal, and scans the area. Again, no one's around. He pulls the bong out again and tries to spark, but the bowl's empty. He feels around under the couch with the backscratcher and drags out a plastic baggie. Empty. He tries again, fishing out another baggie. Empty. One mo try. He shoves the backscratcher as far under the couch a he can reach and methodically pats around. Suddenly, he pulls his hand back, triumphantly clutching booty, but this baggie's empty too.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Fuck. He grabs the cordless beside him and punches numbers.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mick, what's up? I'm dry.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (on phone) So?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: So, how ‘bout bringing over a dimer?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (on phone) Yeah, I'll drop it down your chimney on my way to the North Pole, you lazy fuck. Come over here and get it.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Aw, c'mon. I'm busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Put your dick away and get over here. BEEP, BEEEEEP. The red battery light flashes on the cordless. :

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Fine. He hangs up and shoves bong and baggies under the couch. looks around the room and groans -- his shoes are clear o by the TV. But Anton's in luck -- his Mom's fuzzy slippers lay strew the side of the couch, within easy reach of his backscratcher. Anton doesn't notice the DROPS OF BLOOD speckling the slippers.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Anton drops the still-beeping cordless into its base on t entry table, plucking his sunglasses off the same table a noticing his mother's purse lying there.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (yelling) Mom! (no answer) Mom! Spot me some cash? Still no answer. Fuck it. He reaches into his mom's purse and purloins a ten-dollar bill, careful to leave everythi how he found it. Almost out the door, he looks at the money and rethinks i Reaching back into the purse, he grabs another $10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing his T-shirt, baseball cap, boxer shorts, and bloo flecked slippers, Anton steps outside. The cold Oregon su smacks him in the face and he quickly puts his sunglasses He can see his breath faintly in the brisk October air. From the house on his left, heavy metal music pounds into afternoon. Sighing, Anton turns right and begins his tiresome journe Two houses down the block, he cuts across a yard and clim through an open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton comes through the window, shivering. MICK, PNUB, an JIMMY, all high-school seniors, are sitting on Mick's bed smoking out and engaging in philosophical debate:

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Yeah, and if your mom had teeth, she wouldn't suck dick so well. What's your point? Jimmy finishes his hit, passes the bong to Anton, and spe while exhaling. .

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: My point is that, unlike you, Pnub, I've taken on a certain degree of responsibility. What's up, Anton? Nice boxers. - Anton looks down, slightly embarrassed, at his pantslessn

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Responsibility, my nutsack. You sit around your dad's meat locker all day and flirt with that old lady who answers the phone. That bitch has less teeth than your mom.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You know what these are? (jangling a ring of keys in Pnub's face) These are keys, boy. Keys! My dad's Placed the ultimate trust in me. I'm being prepped to take over the entire meat processing empire. The bong has traveled full circle and Jimmy pauses for another hit.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (holding the smoke in) dust last week, when they installed this new temperature-controlling machine -- you guys should see this monster, it can bring the whole storage area from 100 degrees to the fucking ice age in, like, seconds! Anyway, whose ass do you think was in charge of overseeing the entire process? Jimmy stands up and points at his own ass.  10

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: We're all really happy for your ass, Jimmy. Being an enterprising young man myself, I can relate. Wearing a "D.A.R.E. to Keep Kids Off Drugs" T-shirt, Mick pulls out a baggie of pot and exchanges it for one of Ant ten-dollar bills. Anton takes his cap off and slides the baggie into a hidd slot under the bill. They all nod.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I know I'm jealous. Jimmy can look forward to a future filled with tooth- less receptionists and raw meat, while Mick has a lovely career of license- plate making just around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: What about your future, hotrod?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I'm not going to worry about that shit. (taking a hit off the bong) It's best to just let life happen.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: At least until your parents kick your oily ass out.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (frowning) I haven't seen my parents in a couple of days.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Maybe they went on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Party at Anton's!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: No, it's really weird. My mom always does her shopping on Friday. Yester- day was Friday, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: So I wake up this morning and there's no food, no sign of my parents, but my mom's purse is just lying there on the table.  11

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Maybe they're dead. Pnub smacks Jimmy's leg.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. With that killer on the loose and all, you can't rule out murder.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What killer?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Don't you watch Hard Copy?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I hate that fucking show.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: It's also been on the regular news.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I hate that fucking show, too.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Bolan's national news, Anton. Seems as if a bunch of hacked-up citizens have been found in this general area over the past week.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You guys are just fucking with me, right?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Well, no, but don't worry. There's been like three dead people. Four, tops.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Six.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Your parents probably just decided to slip away for a romantic weekend and your mom forgot her purse. No big whoop.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: At any rate, party at Anton's!  12 Mick lowers the bong and peers out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Hey, here comes your woman, Anton. Anton rushes to the window and ducks.. He slowly lifts on eye just above the sill so he can see. without being seen MOLLY, 17 and drop-dead, zooms past on a Harley.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Molly's lived across the street from you for like, what, ever? I think it's about time you told her about your disturbing obsession with her.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: While you're at it, you should tell her your name.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Back off, guys. Anton doesn't believe in taking initiative. (to Anton) Don't listen to them. You just let life happen.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (giving Mick a dirty look) I'm gonna do it. I'll talk to her right now. He starts out the window.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: You want to borrow some pants, Chief? First impressions and all.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're a bud. Mick points at his closet. Anton grabs a fresh pair of je and hastily yanks them on. Kicking off the slippers, he salutes his friends and crawls out the window.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Think he's got a shot with her?

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Snowball in hell. They all nod. Mick reloads the bong.  13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Anton makes it out Mick's door, Molly is alre parking the hog in her driveway, at the end of the block. Anton crosses to her side of the street and heads toward with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly slides her leather-clad butt off the seat and disappears into her house. Anton leans against a tree and looks expectantly at an upper window. Sure enough, a light goes on and Molly moves into view in upper window, a dark-haired goddess of rebellion. Anton gazes wistfully, longingly, up at her until she gla outside and sees him. He averts his eyes and quickly walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge Winnebago parks in front of the Sheriff's office. DEBI LECURE steps out of the motor home with a newspaper her hand and a parrot on her shoulder. She's about 28, wi long, painted nails and teased Jersey-girl hair. Debi tosses the newspaper onto the driver's seat and gent sets the parrot on top of the newspaper. The headline und the bird reads "SUSPECT CAUGHT IN EUREKA SLAYINGS."

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: (to the parrot) Wait here, Hot Train. I've got to look respectable. Hot Train doesn't respond. Debi slips on a pair of intellectual-looking glasses and locks the parrot in the motor home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debi approaches the DEPUTY behind the holly-decked main d carrying herself stiffly.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Excuse me. It's of the utmost importance that I speak to Sheriff Buchanan.  14

dialogues.speaker: DEPUTY
dialogues.text: Sorry, ma'am, but as you can imagine, the Sheriff's pretty busy.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Perhaps if you understood the gravity of the situation. . . The door to the back office opens and a burly tree-trunk man, SHERIFF BUCHANAN, enters the reception area.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: You must be Sheriff Buchanan. I'm Debi LeCure. She extends a hand. The Sheriff ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: I thought I ran all you creepy press people out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: I'm not with the press. Sir, it's imperative that I speak with Clement James right away.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: Nobody talks to Clement James ‘cept his lawyer and the investigating officers.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: I, too, am an investigator of sorts.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: Is that a fact? Look, Miss Liqueur--

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: LeCure.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: Between you and me, there ain't a whole lot of investigating to be done. We caught him in his bathroom, shaving a cat and wearing nothing but his granny's skivvies. No law against that yet, but the half-dozen dead bodies lounging around his house gives me a wee hunch he's guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't doubt his guilt. My interest lies solely with his motive. Has he attributed his actions to any sort of supernatural intervention?

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF BUCHANAN
dialogues.text: What information Clement James has revealed to the investigating officers is strictly confidential. (he pauses; then) But seeing as you're kinda cute and not with the press, I don't mind telling you, off the record, that he ain't said shit. His mind is so far gone, I doubt if he'll ever utter another word. Debi slumps, visibly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: I see. INT. WINNEBAGO - A MOMENT LATER. Debi scooches the parrot to one side and climbs into the driver's seat, dropping both the glasses and the intellec act.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Well, bird of mine, looks like another dead end. Hot Train doesn't answer. Debi starts her engine, croonin to the parrot.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Pretty bird. Hello, pretty bird. Talk, you fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a brown paper sack and a bag of dog kibble, Anto frowns. He stops walking and looks suspiciously into the gathering mist around him. He takes a few steps and looks again. No one.  le, As Anton continues walking, an UNIDENTIFIABLE FIGURE STAL HIM, staying almost entirely under the mist's cover. Ther something SHIMMERY, SILVERY about him, but then again, it just be the mist. The figure pulls back into the shadows as Anton glances o his shoulder, listening hard. Suddenly, Anton whips his head around to face his stalker put finds only the shifting mist. The SILVERY FIGURE has VANISHED. Shivering, Anton steps into the street. Without warning, he's THROWN TO THE GROUND. His groceries spill into the street. A billy club is pressed hard against the back of his neck shoving his face into the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Frisk him. I'll check his bag. He's thoroughly patted down. His baseball cap is removed Anton holds his breath.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Roll over. Anton rolls onto his back to see TWO UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICERS in their early twenties, sporting the nametags R and MCMACY.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: (kicking Anton's grocery bag) Nothing here. You? Anton's hat is in McMacy's hands, being inspected. Anton tries not to look nervous. McMACY He's clean. McMacy leans over and jerks the baseball cap down on Anto head, the secret hiding place undiscovered.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Damn. Relieved, Anton scrambles of the street and scoops his groceries back into the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when is it against the law to grocery-shop? (looking up’at them, double-taking) Hey, I know you two. Weren't you seniors when I was a freshman?

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: (sinister) That's right. Let's talk about high school, Anton. McCMACY (hauling Anton to his feet) You and your fancy little clique zipping around on your skateboards. Thought you were too cool for us, huh? Did any of you ever, even once, invite us to get high behind the gym?

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: (yanking Anton his way) Or to hang at the half-pipe? Or go to a punk show?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You were dorks! McMACY (turning Anton toward him) But now we're cops, Anton. Your safety and security, your future and your very life are in our hands every single day.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Think about that when you try to sleep tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (shaking his head, amused). Ooh. There's sure nothing scarier than a spiteful nerd with a power woody.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: (marrowing his eyes) Empty your pockets, boy!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Nice try, but they're not even my pants.  Anton pulls. out a crumpled dollar and some change, but something else comes out too, falling to.the ground ...a BAGGIE. McMacy pockets Anton's money and snatches the baggie up. opens it and inhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: MCMACY
dialogues.text: Smells like marijuana to me. Write it up, Ruck. :

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: It's empty! Ruck scribbles on a ticket pad.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What? I know my rights. You can't cite me for possession of baggie! Ruck and McMacy laugh.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Jaywalking. Maximum fine, $200. Ruck tucks the ticket into Anton's grocery bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton tears the jaywalking ticket into strips and lays th out on the coffee table. Removing his stash from his hat, rolls each ticket-strip into a FAT JOINT. He sits back, lights up, and hears a noise: a FLOORBOARD CREAKS upstairs. Anton pauses, listening. Another CREAK, right above him. He mutes the TV. Lying at his feet, Danzig is PANTING loudly. Anton reaches down an CLOSES the DOG'S MOUTH. He listens again, but this time, the house is silent. He shakes his head, dismissing it, and returns to channel surfing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As an Everclear video comes to a loud, crashing end, Anto pours dog kibble into both Danzig's and Bones' bowls. The pets eat.  19 The familiar notes of the MTV NEWS THEME SONG swell up in living room. Watching TV through the open kitchen door, Anton dumps his groceries on the counter -- bologna, whit bread, mayo -- and starts making a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: TABITHA SOREN, (OS)
dialogues.text: This is Tabitha Soren with MTV World News. Without taking his eyes off the TV, he opens the silverwa drawer and fishes around, pulling out a huge, evilly shar knife -- the blade is covered with DRIED BLOOD. Anton twists the top of the mayonnaise.

dialogues.speaker: TABITHA SOREN, (OS)
dialogues.text: There'll be no trick-or-treating for one town this year. Bolan, Oregon, a small suburb of Portland, has been terrorized by seemingly random slayings for the past week. Without looking down, he swirls the knife in the mayo and bits of dried blood come off. Oblivious, Anton spreads it on his bread, slaps on some processed meat, and raises the sandwich to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: TABITHA SOREN, (OS)
dialogues.text: Six bodies have been discovered to date and the killer is still at large. With Halloween only one day away, Bolan police are advising extra caution... Anton takes a bite, chews, and

dialogues.speaker: LOOKS DOWN --
dialogues.text: The bloody knife sticks out of the rust-flecked mayo. ANTON GAGS. In pure terror, he drops his sandwich and flattens himsel against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: He's here! He's in my house! He scans the room, wild-eyed, but the only sounds are the and the dog's eating.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (half-whimpering) Danzig! C'mere, boy.  20 The German Shepherd trots over from his food dish.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (whispering to the dog) If you see, hear, or smell a psycho killer, you bark. Loud. Anton points him at the living room and gives hima shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danzig SLIDES. across the hardwood floor on his butt, com to a stop at the coffee table. Anton peers out from the kitchen. Danzig looks back at hi quizzically and Anton slips into the room, latching tight onto the dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Danzig. We're gonna make it. He creeps toward the entry way in a panic, pointing Danzi the direction of every little NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: With a firm grip on Danzig's collar, Anton's nearly to th front door.

dialogues.speaker: TABITHA SOREN, (OS)
dialogues.text: So, Bolan residents, lock your doors and stay inside tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Fuck that! He reaches for the doorknob. Danzig BARKS FURIOUSLY at th door.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (deadbolting the door) Oh, shit! He's out there! He races up the stairs with Danzig following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton slams his door shut, gasping for breath, and climbs onto his bed, hugging the dog. The house is full of CREAK and GROANS, amplified by Anton's fright.  21

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to the dog) Okay, the plan. The killer's on the porch, but the door's locked. He'll get bored and go kill someone else. Psycho killers only come out at night, so if we make it to morning, we'll be safe. Piece of cake -- we just sleep it off. As he reaches to turn off the light, his closet door CREA OPEN an inch. Danzig BARKS. Anton bolts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton tears into the PARENTS' BEDROOM FROM SCENE 1, lit b the same bedside lamp. The phone is back in its place, bu the long cord is slick with blood. Anton doesn't notice. He leaps onto his parents' bed, pulls the covers up to hi neck, and cowers. He takes a deep breath and tells himsel

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: The sooner you go to sleep, the sooner it'll be morning. He snaps off the lamp and lies back. Looking up at the ceiling, he freezes, seeing the glow-in-the-dark paint:

dialogues.speaker: I'M UNDER THE BED
dialogues.text: Anton is paralyzed with fear. His mouth is open, but sile A beat, then Anton hurls himself off the bed and out the terror-stricken.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: SCREAMING, Anton flies down the stairs, looking back over shoulder in complete hysteria. On his way to the door, he grabs the cordless off the tab but the floor-length TABLECLOTH TRIPS HIM. Anton goes sprawling and the table CRASHES to the floor, exposing, to Anton's horror -- the MUTILATED BODIES of his PARENTS. His mother's face is frozen in a pleading expression, her closed fist held upward by a stiff arm.  22 Anton GASPS. He glances up the staircase with dread, but the killer ha yet to show himself. Unlocking the front door, Anton scoops up Bones, pushes Danzig outside, and runs. EXT. STREET. - SAME. Anton races down the block, cat in one hand and cordless phone in the other, Danzig at his heels. He hurdles a short hedge, landing in Molly's yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's house is dark. Anton drops to his knees behind th hedge, trying to catch his breath. Bones and Danzig eye h Anton looks through the thick leaves at his house. It's quiet and still, dark except for the entry way light and flickering of the TV in the living room. He yanks the cordless phone's antenna to its full length DIALS 911.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello, police? The killer's loose in my house! 3604 Clinton Street. Please hurry, I don't want to die! Hanging up, he leans back against the hedge, panting.

dialogues.speaker: IN MOLLY'S UPSTAIRS WINDOW
dialogues.text: Unnoticed by Anton, Molly peeks through the shutters and watches him curiously. INT. BOLAN POLICE DISPATCH OFFICE — SAME A very tired-looking DISPATCHER presses the button on her police radio.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: One Allen Ten, we have yet another supposed killer sighting. Can you take a look? Over.  nN wh

dialogues.speaker: COP VOICE
dialogues.text: (over radio) - This is One Allen Ten. We still have three more sightings to investigate first, but we're working as fast as we can. We'll check it out as soon as possible, over.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER
dialogues.text: One of these calls has to Pay off, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Molly watches from her window, Anton pulls out a ticket-rolled doobie. But just as he's about to light up, Danzig lays his head on Anton's leg. Anton looks down to pet the dog -- and suddenly spits his joint across the yard... His purple T-shirt is speckled with small blotches of pai GLOWING in the darkness. He holds up the bottom of the sh a small section of fabric is missing, TORN OFF.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Okay. Stay calm. He whirls to look through the hedge again. His house is still silent, motionless. No killer in sight He stands up, musters his courage, and creeps stealthily toward his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton climbs the stairs slowly, alert, but COMPLETELY EXPOSED. The front door is still wide open. MTV hums in the living room. The overturned table is visible, but the bodies are out of sight behind it. Anton moves cautiously through the door. Behind him, Danz WHINES.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Standing over his parents' bodies, Anton shields his eyes from the horrible spectacle.  24 He reaches for his mother's closed fist and . PRIES HER HAND OPEN to reveal A PIECE. OF PURPLE CLOTH. He uncrumples it and holds it to his shirt -- A PERFECT PUZZLE-PIECE MATCH.

dialogues.speaker: QUICK FLASHES
dialogues.text: -- His mother in the bedroom, pleading, crying, -- The HUGE KNIFE in his own hand, slicing through the ai -- His mother tearing at his shirt as she sinks to the fl Anton staggers back from the bodies in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (horrified) The killer was wearing my shirt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton stumbles to the couch on automatic. Videos flash across the TV screen. Anton grabs the remote and switches channels until he finds the news:

dialogues.speaker: TV REPORTER
dialogues.text: + + + so Bolan city officials have decided that the local elementary, junior high, and high schools will hold Halloween parties in lieu of trick-or-treating. Kids will be able to have plenty of safe, secure fun tomorrow night. Back to you, Bruce. Zombie-like, eyes glued to the TV, Anton pulls his stash beneath the couch and loads a bowl. He takes a huge hit. Nearby, the cat YOWLS. Anton winces at the sound.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (without looking) Shut up, Bones, I want to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORMAN
dialogues.text: Several bodies were found in a park not too far from that high school -- mailman Matthew Wright, who was abducted somewhere on his route Tuesday, and Jehovah's Witness Ingrid Renan, who rang her last doorbell sometime on Wednesday.  25 The CAT'S YOWLING continues, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Bones! Shut-- . He turns his head toward the cat and the last word dies o his tongue .. .« Next to him on the couch, Bones YOWLS again, with ANTON'S HAND WRAPPED around the CAT'S THROAT, squeezing.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (letting go) Jesus Christ! Stunned, he stares at his hand in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHORWOMAN
dialogues.text: We now take you live to Bolan, where Jenny Takumatsu has a very personal story about one of the murder victims. Jenny? Anton makes a fist. He opens it. His hand seems to be responding just fine. He pinches his palm with his other hand and YELPS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I'm standing outside the local Burger King, where honor student Kenneth Lippy made a little extra money manning the drive-thru... Horrified, Anton looks at the Burger King bag at his feet and then at his hands. He grabs up the bag, crumples it, shoves it under the couch as... the DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: The cops! He hides his pot.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (heading for the door, muttering) Took ‘em long enough. His PARENTS' CORPSES stop him short.  26

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck! He quickly tries to set the table back up with the bodies hidden beneath it, but it just won't work -- as soon as h gets all the arms tucked in ‘under the tablecloth, a leg sproings out. He. folds the leg in, only to push his Dad' head out the other side. : The DOORBELL RINGS: again.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I'm coming! i He gives the bodies a final, determined shove and the: wh table TIPS OVER.. Anton groans. The DOORBELL CHIMES insistently, over and over.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Jeez, chill! I'm coming! Anton shoves his parents into the COAT CLOSET, stands the table up, and opens the front door. Mick, Pnub, and Jimmy surge into the room with beer and b

dialogues.speaker: MICK, PNUB, JIMMY
dialogues.text: Party at Anton's! Pnub and Jimmy beeline for the TV in the living room and Anton goes weak with relief. Sweat slicks across his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Hey, you okay? You got a fever? Mick holds a frosty 12-oz to Anton's forehead.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're not going to believe this.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: What's up? Taking the beer from Mick, Anton looks carefully into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pnub and Jimmy are kicked back on the couch, smoking out. Jimmy changes the channel and Pnub chokes on his smoke, aggravated.  27

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: What the fuck, yo?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What? . Pnub grabs the remote and smacks Jimmy with it before set the channel back to MIV. "Freefalling" fills the air.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Tom Petty rockumentary, dickhead. Don't change it again. JI want to see that video where he tools around the desert in his space buggy.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Satisfied that Pnub and Jimmy are occupied, Anton twists bottlecap off his beer and pulls Mick over to the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Swear to take this to your grave?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Swear.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I've been --

dialogues.speaker: PNUB, (OS)
dialogues.text: (yelling) Anton! You got any grub?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (OS)
dialogues.text: (yelling) We're starved!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to Mick) Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pnub and Jimmy are ambling toward the kitchen. Anton race past them.  28

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton grabs the open mayo jar off the counter -- with the BLOODY KNIFE still sticking out the top -- and shoves the whole lot into the dishwasher. He slams the dishwasher.shut as Jimmy and Pnub enter.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Here you go. Anton gestures to the bread and bologna still open on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: You're a great host, Anton.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: We're out of mayo.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Mick is taking his jacket off as Anton enters. Anton thro a panicked glance at the coat closet door, but Mick tosse his jacket over the banister.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Well? Anton guzzles his beer, takes a deep breath, and:

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I think I might be a psychotic serial killer.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Anton, I've known you since third grade. You're not psychotic.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What if I killed all those people on the news?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Remember that time me and Pnub pulled the legs off that grasshopper? You wussed out.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Regardless.  29

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) I don't buy it. Look at you, you're normal. .

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I'm telling you! I even killed my own parents. How demented is that?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Calm down. It's probably just bad pot. / A beat as Anton considers this. He looks at Mick hopefull

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Well, not if you got it from me. I only sell primo shit. Anton looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: I'll bet it's just some particularly gruesome acid flashbacks. Hey! You know how sometimes when you take acid, you get so into the trip you forget you took it?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay, buddy. Acid never lasts longer than 12 or 14 hours. I'll ride it out with you, talk you down.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mick. You could be right. God, I hope you're right. (beat ) Mick? You didn't take any acid today, did you?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Not that I recall.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Then tell me if you see what I see.  30 Anton opens the closet door. His Parents spill out at Mic feet. Mick takes a step back.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Fuck me! Anton, you are one sick puppy -

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (anguished) It's true! The killer wasn't just wearing my shirt, the killer was wearing me! I mean, I'm the killer! Anton waves the beer bottle for emphasis as the DOORBELL RINGS. He turns toward the front door. RED AND WHITE LIGH FLASH outside. ANTON . Mick! Help me get the bodies back-- Turning back, Anton sees Mick SLUMP to the floor. Anton's BEER BOTTLE, BROKEN, is PLANTED DEEP in Mick's forehead. Anton looks down at his empty hand in disbelief The DOORBELL RINGS again and Anton wastes no time pushing bodies -- Mick's included -- into the coat closet.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB, (OS)
dialogues.text: Anton, you want me to get that? Anton closes the closet door and rubs out a spot of blood with his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: * I got it. It's the fuzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pnub and Jimmy, destroying the evidence, immediately star eating their pot and lighting incense, frantically trying wave away the smoke hanging in the air.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ENTRY WAY
dialogues.text: Anton opens the door to Ruck and McMacy.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Looky who we got here, McMacy. It's Mr. Baggie.  31

dialogues.speaker: MCMACY
dialogues.text: You called, Anton?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (feigning innocence) I did?

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: (checking his pad) 3604 Clinton Street. That's you.

dialogues.speaker: MCMACY
dialogues.text: So where's this killer you reported?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Sorry, no killer here. Must've been a prank. Anton tries to close the door, but Ruck blocks it, leanin against the doorframe like he's got all night. Anton points.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: A prank? You know what the sentence is for playing games with the law, Anton?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: No, see, I didn't prank you. It must've been, uh, Mick. Yeah, you guys remember Mick -- he used to skate past the Physics Club and spit on you. He lives two houses down. McMacy pulls out his handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MCMACY
dialogues.text: Let's take him downtown.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: I have a better idea. Let's watch him. Closely.

dialogues.speaker: MCMACY
dialogues.text: (nodding) Every breath he takes.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Every move he makes. (pointing a completely serious finger at Anton) We'll be watching you.  32 The cops turn to saunter down the porch steps. Anton slam the door. He fingers Mick's jacket forlornly before headi into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pnub and Jimmy already have their pot back out, loading t bowls to the last few notes of “You Got Lucky, Babe." On Tv, Tom Petty drives away in his space buggy and the vide ends. Anton steps. up behind the couch, visibly shaken. PNUB . Anton, dude, that was hairy. I couldn't even enjoy the video.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: You really shouldn't prank the cops, Anton. They have enough to do, what with stamping out evil and all. Where's Mick?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: He went home with a headache. You guys should head out too.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: What? We're crashing here tonight. It's cool, the cops are gone.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Anton, no one else's parents are out of town. Don't be selfish. (motioning. at the TV) Besides, they're about to show that Tom Petty duet -- you know, with that hippie girlie? We can't go now.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Seriously, guys, it's for your own good. I don't think I have a whole lot of control over--

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: (cutting him off) Shhhhi! It's on. Pnub's eyes are fixed on the TV and he doesn't even look the cause of the loud, sudden SLICING SOUND next to him, the subsequent GURGLE.  33 JIMMY'S HEAD rolls into his own lap, unrestrained by his neck. It bounces just a little, and continues to the floo landing with a dull thud on Pnub's scuffed Chuck Taylors.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (aghast) Shit!!! Pnub, Pnub! Pnub tears himself from the TV and turns just in time to Jimmy's body follow his head to the floor. INNARDS spill through a GAPING WOUND in Jimmy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Fucking Christ! Anton comes around the couch, looking with absolute terro the huge knife in his hand. Blood (and a little mayo) dri from the knife's wicked tip.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (freaking) How does this keep happening??? Pnub scrambles backward into a corner, shaking, as Anton advances on him, unable to stop.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Are you out of your mind?! Snap out of it! It's me, Pnub, your buddy! Anton FIGHTS WITH HIMSELF, holding the knife out at Pnub his right hand and trying to restrain it with his left.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I know who you are, Pnub, you dumb fuck! I'm not doing this on purpose! Anton struggles to hold himself back, but she" s drawn irresistibly toward Pnub.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Get out of here! I don't know how long I can hold off! Anton steps over Jimmy's body. A bloody ARTERY catches on his shoe and STRETCHES as Anton moves toward Pnub, slowly pulling Jimmy's heart from his chest. JIMMY'S HEART SLIPS ACROSS THE FLOOR behind Anton as. . .

dialogues.speaker: TOM PETTY, STEVIE NICKS
dialogues.text: (singing, on TV) Stop draggin' my, stop draggin' my, stop draggin' my heart around...  It's too much for Pnub. He SCREAMS. Anton looms above Pnub, knife glinting. Pnub covers his h with his arms.. Anton REACHES DOWN. . . and grabs Pnub's hand, hauling him to his feet. Pnub SHRIEKS. Anton shoves Pnub toward the front door. Giving Jimmy's corpse a wide berth, Pnub stubs his toes on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Run, damn it! The knife raises Anton's hand into the air. Anton grapple with it, using all his might to keep the knife still.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Run! Pnub limps hurriedly for the door as

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM NOWHERE
dialogues.text: (sinister whisper) Kill him. Anton looks wildly around the room for the source of the voice.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE FROM NOWHERE
dialogues.text: (louder) Kill him! Anton's own SCREAMS add to Pnub's as his right arm is pul back like a catapult by an UNSEEN FORCE. Just as Pnub reaches the door, the unseen force lets go o Anton's arm and the KNIFE ZINGS THROUGH THE AIR... slamming into the back of Pnub's skull with a SICKENING SMACK. Pnub crumples. Still SCREAMING, Anton covers his eyes and runs blindly out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton hightails it across lawns and driveways in utter hysteria, tripping over the hedge and sprawls into Molly' yard. Panting, he leaps to his feet and races down the block.  35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton half-runs, half-stumbles into the park, gasping for breath and checking behind him. ‘Several sections of the park's thick hedge are ROPED OFF with yellow police crime scene tape. He rushes for a set of monkey bars, but the entire struct COLLAPSES just as he's about to duck under it. Anton veers to the right, floundering into the sandbox, a the BLOODY KNIFE THRUSTS up out of the sand in front of h He whirls again, disoriented, as a DISEMBODIED LAUGH fill the park, an evil, bone-chilling rumble rising from nowhe and everywhere. Anton bones out, heading back towards home. EXT. STREET — SAME Anton hurries down the dark street, spooked by every soun and trying hard to keep a look-out in every direction. Suddenly, the KNIFE SHOVES THROUGH THE SIDEWALK between h legs, pointing the tip STRAIGHT UP at his balls. Anton yelps, startled out of his wits, and dives behind a bush in someone's front yard. A LIGHT GOES ON in the house. It's Molly's house. It's Molly's bedroom light. She opens her window and looks dow at the rustling bush.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Who's out there? Anton rolls out of the bush, onto the grass.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (smirking a little) Oh, it's you.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (brushes himself off) Hi. Sorry about your bush. The KNIFE APPEARS in Anton's hand. He quickly hides it behind his back and flings it to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Not a problem. Are you planning to do this all night?  36 The knife puts itself firmly in Anton's -hand again.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Do what? Behind his back, he tries to drop the knife, but it seems be attached. He shakes his hand. The knife remains.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Sneak around my.yard. How many times have you been here tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (distracted) Uh, twice? He shakes the knife violently behind his back, but it ref to leave his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Wait there. She disappears from her window. Of it's own accord, Anton hand brings the knife in front of his body. His other han joins the first on the knife handle and the evil blade PO straight at Molly's door. Anton immediately turns away. Holding the knife over the bush, Anton gives his hands a sharp, fierce BITE. He yelps and drops the knife. It falls into the bush just Molly opens the front door.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Get in here before someone sees you. Anton heads inside and Molly closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton and Molly enter her room quietly. She looks him up down.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Jesus, look at you. Anton looks at himself. His shirt and Mick's pants are covered with blood, dirt, and bush.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I got into a fight at the park.  37 MOLLY . You sure got your ass’ kicked.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I did okay.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: So you ran and hid in my bush? Anton's eyes focus on a letter opener on Molly's desk and gets a QUICK FLASH of the letter opener VICIOUSLY SLASHIN Molly's throat open. Anton shakes the image from his head but POTENTIAL WEAPON seem to leap out at him: a stapler, an extension cord, a hairdryer, a Hello Kitty pen and pencil set. Anton shudders.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I really shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: It's okay. My parents sleep like the dead. Besides, you shouldn't be on the streets at night. Don't you know there's a killer out there? Anton's hands abruptly grab Molly and pull her close, bringing their faces just an inch apart. Anton plants a passionate kiss on her.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: (coming up for air) I'm impressed. The way you've been creeping around and spying on me, I never would've thought you'd have the balls to just kiss me like that.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (surprised at himself) Me neither. She grins and pushes him onto the bed. He pulls off her shirt. She closes her eyes as he runs his hands up her stomach, over her breasts . . . and ONTO HER THROAT. His hands linger, circling her neck, itching to squeeze, until he forces them to glide over her face and through h hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debi's Winnebago is parked off to the side by itself, as as possible from the crowd at the restrooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Train watches the Northern California weather report tiny battery-powered TV. Across the motor home's one room, Debi untacks newspaper articles from her-wall. The 20-plus articles clustered . together all have headlines about multiple murder in Eure and suspected serial killer Clement James. Debi calls over her shoulder:

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Hello, pretty bird, hello. Hot Train ignores her. Debi slips the articles into a file folder headed C. JAME and turns. Every wall is plastered with current newspaper articles. Grouped together by locale, they detail evil of every sort.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: (on TV) According to officials, the Bolan, Oregon, slayings are the most gruesome since Jeffrey Dahmer. Tacked above the TV is a collection of articles relating the Bolan murders. Debi sits next to Hot Train and turns the volume up.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Police have yet to pinpoint even a single suspect ... Debi hauls a huge road atlas onto her lap and flips it op to Oregon.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Straight up I-5, Hot Train. We'll be there by mid-morning. Cross your scaly little bird-toes that we catch him and end this thing. Hot Train keeps his eyes on the TV.  39

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Pretty bird. Hello, hello, hello! (poking at him) You know, that pet shop boy in . Omaha promised you'd be talking by Texas. If I'd wanted solitude, I'd have bought a cat. (beat) I could still get a cat, you know. How would you like that? Nada from ‘the bird.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Talk, damn it! Pretty bird, pretty bird! Look, bird, it's your job, plain and simple. Do you see me shirking my duty? Did anyone ask Debi if she'd like a normal life? Friends? A relationship? A toilet I don't have to drain every 600 miles? She takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: No! Nobody asked and all I have until this ordeal's over is this crappy Winnebago and you. The least you could do is say hello. Hot Train tilts his head toward her, maddeningly silent.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Fine. She stomps away, snapping all the curtains shut. After making sure every door is securely locked, Debi crawls un the kitchen table with the C. JAMES file folder. A small, thick SAFE is snugly wedged beneath the table. Debi deftly positions each of the safe's three combinatio locks and pulls the heavy door open. Hundreds of files, each headed with a different name and packed with newsprint, are stacked inside. As Debi adds t new file, her hand brushes against the ONLY OTHER ITEM in safe: A tightly-rolled SCROLL of ancient parchment GLOWS bright in the dark safe.  40

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton wakes with a start and looks at Molly. She's lying the bed, very still. Panicky, he grabs a hand mirror from her night stand and holds it to her open mouth. It fogs u He breathes a sigh of relief. Putting his clothes on, Ant goes to the window and stares out at the cold morning, melancholy, until -- A hand touches his shoulder. Anton whips around in a pani but it's just Molly, wrapped in a blanket. She laughs lightly.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: At ease, soldier. What are you doing over here?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Thinking about the snow plow. It's almost winter.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hand me that teddy? Anton gives her the stuffed bear on the windowsill. She pulls a baggie of The Kind from a hole in the bear's bell and Anton smiles. Molly smiles back and rolls a nice, tight joint. They pas it back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: What about the snow plow?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: The first really big snow I can remember, I was four. I was so jazzed, I spent all day making this amazing snow fort, with two tunnel entrances and enough room inside to stand up straight. It was the biggest, baddest thing I'd ever done. (pausing, remembering) Then my mom called me in. I was at the window, staring at it, so proud, when I heard this huge rumble. I watched, helpless, as a snow plow flattened it. He meets Molly's eyes and shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Now I just figure what's the point?  41

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Why'd you build your fort in the street? Anton looks stunned. Finally, in- wonderment:

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I don't know. They hear a DOOR CREAK OPEN somewhere in the house. Molly looks at the clock -- 6:45 am.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Better be on your way, babysnakes. My parents might take offense to some dirty, bloody boy banging their daughter. Anton looks at his clothes. They haven't gotten any clean

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Yeah. I've got some things to take care of. They can hear her parents now, up and about in the house.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I guess I should go out your window, huh? That always works in the movies.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hey, whatever loads your bowl. Why don't you come by around seven? We'll go to the dance.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I thought you said the streets weren't safe at night. She pulls him close for a final kiss.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: I'll protect you.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're pretty cool. He swings his legs over the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Hey! What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Anton. My name's Anton.  42

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: Aren't you in my biology: class?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (grinning & pushing off) Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton lands, rolling across the grass under a heavily overcast sky. He heads for home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton enters to find the scene unchanged. The cat is lick delicately at Jimmy's open chest wound.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Bones! Get away from there! Bones ignores him. Anton yanks the cat away from the corp and holds her tight, surveying the carnage with dismay. Bones licks Anton on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (pulling the cat away) Sick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton opens the front door with Bones in his arms and set the cat on the welcome mat. He turns back to the. house.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Danzig! Danzig, c'mere boy! The dog joins them on the porch, sitting beside Bones.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Guys, this isn't easy for me, but you have to understand. You're not safe here. The pets stare up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I think you two will be fine on your own. Bones immediately scampers away. Anton looks at Danzig.  43

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Like I was saying, Danzig, this is a pretty affluent neighborhood, so you shouldn't have too much trouble latching onto someone good. Danzig continues to stare up at him.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Go on. Anton turns the dog around and gives him a gentle shove. Danzig goes as far as the sidewalk and looks back at Anto with pleading puppy-eyes. Anton takes a big gulp of air.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You didn't do anything wrong, buddy. It's for your own good. Danzig finally trots off down the street.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (calling after him) Try the Andersons -- they have a Shitzu in heat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton shovels the final few loads of hard, cold dirt onto MASS GRAVE, carefully packs the loose dirt down with the shovel, and steps back. He turns abruptly and yanks a flowerless rhododendron bus out of the ground by the house, re-planting it atop the grave. He squeezes his eyes shut for a moment of reflection, but can't bring himself to say anything over the grave. Turning away, he sees Danzig peeking around the corner of house at him. Anton sighs sadly, the breath catching in his throat. Wit all his might:

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (yelling at the dog) Go!  44 Danzig jumps and looks confused, but doesn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Get away! Now! Anton runs menacingly at him, shaking his fist, and Danzi takes the hint. Miserable, Anton watches his dog run. . A LOW MOAN swells ‘up behind him. Anton turns. The backya is empty. Another MOAN... Anton creeps slowly toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Anton! Anton stops short. The voice seems to be coming from his fresh grave. A moment's hesitation, and then he goes slow to the grave's edge.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (OS)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Anton, help me! Anton gasps. Then he shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) It's a trick.

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: Bro, come on, I can't breathe down here.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Mick? Anton cautiously leans onto the grave and puts his EAR to ground... .-

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Mick?

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (OS)
dialogues.text: Yeah, man. Get me outta here! The voice is undeniably coming from under the ground. Ant jerks his head away and shoots back.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (spooked) You're dead.  45

dialogues.speaker: MICK, (OS)
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. You conked me on the head pretty good. I must've been unconscious. Anton wavers uncertainly, but keeps his distance.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: I know, fucker. Dig me up!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're not a flesh-eating zombie, come back to extract revenge?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Dammit, Anton!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I'm pretty sure you're going to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: If I don't get a bong hit soon, I'll consider it. The dirt on top of the grave begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Stop it! You stay where you are, Mick! You hear me? The ground starts to rise, cracking open slightly. Anton glances around wildly.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Danzig! Danzig, come back, boy! But the dog is long gone. Anton is breathing hard, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Mick! If you were ever my bud, you won't do this. A chilling MOAN rumbles from the ground as the crack wide Anton looks around in a panic for something, anything -~ the SHOVEL! It's on the other side of the opening grave. Anton crawls toward it on his hands and knees.  46 Taking his eyes off the grave for a split-second, he lung for the shovel. Just as his fingers are about to close around the handle, the shovel is WHISKED AWAY. Anton spins around. MICK'S DIRTY, DECOMPOSING BODY is HALF OUT OF THE GRAVE, broken beer bottle still embedded in his forehead. Anton falls backward. Mick LOOMS ABOVE HIM, brandishing t shovel. Anton can barely whisper:

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Please don't kill me. Mick RAISES THE SHOVEL. Anton's eyes widen in terror and

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. Why would I want to kill you? Mick uses the shovel to dig his body the rest of the way of the dirt. Glimpses of Jimmy and Pnub's bodies are visi in the grave.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (relaxing a little) Okay, good. Wow, I'm really glad you're alive, Mick. Anton slings an arm affectionately over his buddy's shoul -- and abruptly double-takes on the dried blood caked aro the bottle embedded in Mick's forehead. Mick is an uneart shade of pale to boot.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (off Anton's frown) What?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Just a sec. Anton grabs the beer bottle and YANKS, tearing the broken glass from Mick's skull. A large CHUNK of MICK'S FLESH co away with it, exposing bone, but not a single drop of blo Mick doesn't flinch.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (backing away) You weren't just unconscious. You're dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, undead.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Hey, you killed me! Try to keep this in perspective. Now chill and listen to me. I'm supposed to give you a message from Satan.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Right. Look, there's only so much a guy can accept in one day, alright?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: He said your body count's too low and you're slacking off. He wants you to slaughter a few hundred people tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Sure, Mick, like I'm gonna believe that. Yeah, uh-huh, "the devil made me do it." What, was I possessed? Anton laughs derisively. Then, suddenly--

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (realizing) Actually, you know what? That makes sense! (freaking) Jesus Christ!!! Satan???

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Heavy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I mean, the actual Devjl?

dialogues.speaker: _ MICK
dialogues.text: Yeah. So I'm supposed to scare the shit out of you now.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is crazy. Crazy! You gotta get a grip here, Anton. (to Mick) Did Satan happen to mention how I could get him to leave me alone?  48 MICK . No. Now listen, I'm supp--

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (deep in thought) I need an exorcist. A priest. LOUD MUSIC starts pounding from the neighbors’ place, snagging Anton's attention. The music is distinctly '80s metal. It's distinctly Iron Maiden.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: That's it! He heads for the fence separating his yard from the neighbors'.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Anton! But Anton hops the fence and disappears. Mick takes a cou steps toward the fence, but stops.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck it. Mick turns back to the grave and gingerly nudges Pnub's b with his toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton frantically pounds on the back door.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (yanking the door open) Devon? Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton rushes in. The music is louder here -- Maiden's "66

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (yelling) Curtis? Anyone home? The living room walls are plastered floor to ceiling with metal band posters: Black Sabbath, Iron Maiden, Blue Oyst Cult, Ronnie James Dio, Motley Crue. A huge cloth Union J covers the picture windows, obscuring the daylight.  49 two dirtheads in their late 20s, CURTIS and JOE, are pass out on the couch. ~

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Guys! Wake up! He tries desperately to shake Joe into consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: JOE
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Joe turns over. Anton shakes Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Come on, wake up! I really need your help. Curtis doesn't budge. Anton races for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (yelling) Devon! Where ya at? The MUSIC IS EVEN LOUDER by the front door, coming from t front yard. Anton opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton trips over the source of the heavy metal: a boombox next to a blue Chevy Nova in the driveway. He goes sprawling, coming face-to-face with a PAIR OF LEG poking out from under the MOTHER OF ALL TRUCKS. Anton tugs on the pantleg in a frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Dev! I need your help. DEVON rolls out from under the truck, lying on his back o creeper -- one of those boards with wheels. About 28, wit scraggly hair down to his shoulders, a thin mustache, and black mesh half-shirt, Devon is pure rocker.

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: ‘Sup, Anton? Check out the Ford, man. New shocks and springs.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Listen, you've got to help me.

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: Chill, it's okay. I'll buy you beer.  50

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (shaking his head frantically) I'm being possessed. Tell me everything you know about the Devil.

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: Why would I know anything about the Devil? Anton points to the boombox.

dialogues.speaker: BOOMBOX
dialogues.text: Six, six, six, the number of the beast...

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You listen to this shit all the time. You must have picked up some info on the guy.

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: Are you out of your fucking mind? It's just music. Like Mozart and that other fag --

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Beethoven?

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: That's the guy. It's just like their music, only louder. Fucking people are always trying to read into it, saying metal controls our minds with backward messages and shit. I wasted a whole year trying to hear a back- ward message on that Judas Priest album and all I got was a scratched-up fucking record.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Satan is real and he's lurking me. If you won't help me, can I at least borrow your truck?

dialogues.speaker: DEVON
dialogues.text: You are out of your mind. You know no one touches the Ford. I'll take you for a spin, though, test out my new shocks.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (nodding) You know where Retirement Haven is?  51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debi's motor home monopolizes several spaces in front of Bolan Police Headquarters. Beside it, Ruck and McMacy pul a HANDCUFFED GUY out of their squad car.

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: Hey, I'll give you guys fifty bucks if you let me go. The two cops look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Each? The guy nods. Ruck and McMacy make sure the coast is clea and uncuff him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sniffling and looking bereft in head-to-toe black, Debi i seated at a desk in the bustling office. Across the room, junior officer points her out to CAPTAIN TIDWELL. Captain Tidwell strides over, offering his hand to Debi.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TIDWELL
dialogues.text: I'm Captain Tidwell. I understand you're Ingrid Renan's sister? Debi dabs at her eyes with a Kleenex and smiles up at him through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Yes. Lisa Renan.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TIDWELL
dialogues.text: My condolences, Miss Renan. Terrible, terrible.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Thank you for seeing me, sir. I have to know if there's been any news at all.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TIDWELL
dialogues.text: My force is doing everything in our power.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Please understand, it's just so hard to sit at home not knowing who or why. If you could just tell me you have a suspect, my family could rest easier.  Captain Tidwell sighs and ushers Debi into an office. closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TIDWELL
dialogues.text: As the entire town is aware, the killer hasn't left a single clue. I'll be straight with you -- now that the killing seems to have stopped, we have little to go on.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Stopped?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TIDWELL
dialogues.text: Not a single body has been found in the past several days. Happens all the time. These nuts quit as suddenly as they began. The harsh truth is, it's likely we'll never discover his identity.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: (dropping her bereaved act) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debi sits at the kitchen table.

dialogues.speaker: DEBI
dialogues.text: Missed him again, Hot Train. Hot Train eyes her in silence. He Pushing aside a newspaper article with victim Ingrid Rena name circled, she prints "Unknown Bolan Killer" on a fres file folder. Dejectedly, she begins taking Bolan-related articles down from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: EXT CITY STREET
dialogues.text: Devon and Anton drive past a Burger King, where a pack of MOURNERS gather around a shrine of candles obstructing th drive-thru. A line of cars trying to use the drine-thru HONK as the Manager pleads with the mourners to clear the way. don't budge. They  53

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton hops out of Devon's truck and Devon peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anton walks down a long hallway peppered with OLD PEOPLE. Anton passes him, a particularily ancient GENTLEMAN slips from his wheelchair and falls to the floor, DEAD. Anton immediately looks at his own hands as an ORDERLY ru over to check the guy for any signs of life. .

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (seriously distressed) I didn't even touch him, I swear! The orderly gives Anton an odd look and Anton hurries dow the hall. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAMS is knitting in an overstuffed easy chair as Anton appears in the open doorway. He knocks on the door frame.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Anton! How nice of you to visit!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: How's it going, Grams?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Come in. Sit, sit. Anton pulls up a chair.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Look how you've grown! You're getting to be such a handsome young buck. How are your parents?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: That's kinda what I want to talk to you about. .. A. badly-wrinkled OLD MAN moseys in and sits on the arm o Grams’ chair. He puts his hand on her knee.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Anton, I'd like you to meet my boyfriend, Leon.  54

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I was hoping we could speak in private.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something, sonny. If I had a horse, I'd buy it oats and fuck it.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: You can speak freely in front of Leon, dear. ‘He's a few sandwiches short of a. picnic.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Pickin's are pretty slim here, huh, Grams? Grams sighs and nods.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Grams, I really need your help. I know you believe in superstitions and all that dark magic stuff.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Ran my own cult for 35 years.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Yeah, so I figured you'd understand. See, I...1...

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Spit it out, dear.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: The Devil is using me as an instrument of death.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: Boy's a killer, Reba.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Hush, Leon. Anton, I'm really not surprised.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way your parents raised you, letting you sit around on your duff all day watching TV, it makes perfect sense. Did you learn one single constructive thing today in school?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: It's Sunday, Grams.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) It's the old Idle Hands clause. Satan is taking his due.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Idle hands are the Devil's play- ground, Anton. I don't blame you, of course.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (frowning) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: It's your parents' fault. You've always been a very lazy boy and they've done nothing to correct it.

dialogues.speaker: LEON
dialogues.text: I've always said this younger generation is lazy. You need to learn discipline and self-control. Whoops, soiled myself again. Leon hops out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Hand me the phone, Anton. We'll get your parents over here and put an end to this.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (very quietly, pained) Grams, I killed Mom and Dad.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. 55  56

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: And my friends and-- Oh, no! Grams, what if I . . . What if the Devil makes me kill you, too? Anton staggers backward with huge, scared eyes. ANTON . I better go.

dialogues.speaker: GRAMS
dialogues.text: It's okay, Anton, I have an idea that just might save you. Come here. Anton approaches her reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TV is on and Anton is kicked back in his usual spot o the couch, happy as a clam.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (to the TV) You tell ‘em, Mr. Furley! PAN DOWN to reveal Anton's hands busily KNITTING. About 3 feet of green scarf stretch across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (laughing at the TV) And to think, it's all just a big misunderstanding. Suddenly, the front door flies open. In walk the decompos bodies of Mick, Pnub, and Jimmy, their death wounds gapin Jimmy holds his head in one hand and his heart -- still attached to his innards by a vein ~- in the other.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (leaping to his feet) Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Relax. We're not here to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Are you bringing another message from Satan?

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: No, we just need a place to kick it.  The three corpses plop down on Anton's couch.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Turns out we didn't make the cut. Heaven or Hell. We're fully border- line.

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: So now we're in limbo until we avenge our deaths.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (backing up against the TV) I knew it! You guys are gonna smite me!

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Dammit, Anton, calm down. We like limbo. It's cool, we get to just hang out. No school, no jobs, nothing's expected of us.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY'S HEAD
dialogues.text: Anton, you're blocking the TV. Jack's about to accuse Janet of being a dyke. Jimmy holds his head out to the side to can see around An

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You're lying. You guys came from hell. Why else would you bring a message from Satan?

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: He knew we were coming back to Earth, so he stops me on the way and asks me to do him a favor. What am I gonna say? No?

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Yeah, why would we go to Hell? We're not evil. I mean, it's not like we're good or anything, but at least we don't go around killing people.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you, I didn't kill anyone on purpose.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: So you knit now?  58 Anton looks down at the knitting needles in his hands. They're idle. He immediately starts knitting again.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Yeah, my grandmother broke it down for me. Idle hands are the Devil's playground. I have to keep my hands busy.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Anton, I don't think that saying is meant literally. It's more, you know...

dialogues.speaker: PNUB
dialogues.text: Metaphorical.

dialogues.speaker: MICK
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) My hands are the only things I. have trouble controlling. The rest of me responds to my brain just fine. The knitting keeps my hands. occupied while freeing my mind up for other stuff. Anton squeezes onto the couch with the guys and starts watching TV, knitting away. Mick fishes the bong out from under the couch and lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop car pulls up. Ruck and McMacy hop out and sneak aro the side of the house.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
dialogues.text: Let's see what our boy's up to. They peek in a window and GASP as they see Anton knitting next to three motionless, open-mouthed corpses. Jimmy's h rests on his lap. Ruck and McMacy duck down.

dialogues.speaker: RUCK
